data.title: Great Place!
data.text: Excellent food with an excellent selection of beer and the friendliest staff and bartenders who can make an outstanding drink.

data.title: Taproom type of place
data.text: It pretty much was as expected . They had an extra xclent selection of beers on tap and had a Virginia special going. I had the meatloaf and my wife a burger, both were good

data.title: Cozy Little Find!
data.text:
What a super find here in Hampton, VA!  Cozy, friendly, welcoming place that we stumbled upon. Extensive brew list was generous and eclectic; wait staff, Juls, was delightful, friendly, accommodating, efficient, and helpful..checking on us often without hovering. The best part was the food!!! The mussels were the best we've had all summer, surprisingly with vinegar, garlic and other wonderful flavors, really!! we've found that small mussels are the best, no grit, not rubbery like large ones often are..also had a Cesear that was really good, and husband had a seafood pasta that was excellent. Nice choice of appetizers, small plates, sandwiches, or entrees...Kudos to the chef on all accounts. 
It was a good experience all around, eclectic clientele, nice choice of seating with upstairs dining, or booths and high tables downstairs along with the bar. Every city should have a Taphouse like this one!
Definitely will return!

data.title: good service but one of the dirtiest places I've ever been in
data.text: Went there during happy hour, sat at the bar.  The bartender was very good, warm welcoming.  I put my arms on the bar and it was very sticky.  The bar stools were torn, floor dirty, dark and dingy but I wanted to try their food.  She suggested the wraps and I ordered it.  It was actually good and fresh, with salad.  Would not go again due to the need for a total upgrade of the entire restaurant.

data.title: Great Beer Choices
data.text: Variety of beers is great and atmosphere is also good.  Have had the opportunity to visit often and had dinner.

data.title: Great place for a beer and live music
data.text: Kind of dark and dingy. But it's on a nice street across the air and space museum. Good Food was ok. Beer was pricey at $6 /glass.

data.title: Best saloon food ever!
data.text: We stopped in for a drink before a dinner reservation elsewhere but ended up with appetizers too.  I am not a beer drinker but those that were had a ton of choices.  Our server made suggestions on beers, gave samples and answered many questions.  The place is nothing fancy looking like an old time saloon and surprised us with such good food.  We got hummus and fries.  Sounds easy but they make their own hummus and it was delicious.  And the basket of fries were perfect-- crispy outside and soft inside!  In the end I wished we had stayed to have dinner here.

data.title: Amazing your taste buds will love you
data.text: My bf had the meatloaf absolutely delicious.  I had the mussells above excellent. ... wine was great... very attentive and down to earth staff. Great atmosphere. Great music. Lots of locals , very friendly folks. The oyster were not what I was hoping for,  very small no horse radish.... All was well my dessert blackberry cobbler. The best ever!!!

data.title: it was ok, didn't feel welcome
data.text: It took forever to get a beer, it seemed the watiress didn't really want to be there. My food was served cold I sent it back , it got a quick mirco wasn't that good got the cornbeef plate

data.title: The food is as good as the beer.
data.text: I walked in just looking for some good brew on tap.  It looked a bit like a dive with torn bar stool cushions.  I was a little hungry so took a chance ordering the shrimp pesto.  I was blown away with the balsamic vinegar reduction and the tomato puree.  And of course, the beer was excellent.

data.title: Wonderful Beer Selection and great pub food.
data.text: Visited for both lunch and dinner multiple times. Always enjoyed the food thought always selected that cheesiest unhealthy items. Has the feeling of a dive with missing floor titles, banged up chairs, and a used look; but the food is always tasty and my healthier friends even enjoy the salads. Normally daily (or at least) weekly specials and the staff are very knowledgable about the beer and some can offer pairings options. Though service can be a mixed bag during the lunch rush a visit is worth it. Searching for some pub food and drinks day or night this is your place in downtown Hampton.

data.title: Soft shell crab and beer
data.text: Stopped in recently for lunch and a friendly bartender recommend the soft shell crab BLT.  Very tasty...lots of bacon....they have a great beer selection too

data.title: Awesome joint!
data.text: Corn beef is amazing! Great beer selection. Decent price point. Great little local joint. Will definitely be back!!!!

data.title: Great happy hour spot
data.text: We came here before seeing a show at the Coliseum.  A quick $6 Uber ride away.  But well worth it to avoid all the chain restaurants near our hotel.  Big beer selection, plus $3 pints on certain beers on Monday!!  The food was good.

data.title: Best Restaurant in Hampton
data.text: If you live in/near Hampton, then you need to visit the Hampton Tap House. I Highly recommend any of their seafood dishes (Pan Crab Sandwich) and the crab dip appetizer with bread. Also, you really cannot go wrong with the daily specials. Also, I HIGHLY recommend you visit this place for brunch on Sunday.  They have an awesome Bread Pudding French Toast and Crab Cakes Eggs Benedict.  If neither of those meet your fancy, you can go for the Giant, and tasty Iron Skillet.  Be sure to get there early for brunch (10:30am) becuase they will fill up fast leading to 20-40 minute waits.

data.title: Great service, food and beer selection
data.text: Had an enjoyable mid week lunch there before going to the Air and Space museum nearby. Outstanding beer selection!  Stephanie, our server was excellent - friendly, attentive and deserves an award for Customer Service.  My wife enjoyed the meatloaf and I had the mussels (steamed in cider) - perfectly cooked and seasoned just right. Will definitely return.

data.title: A Craft Brew Lovers Treasure!
data.text: What a great place!  We stopped in on our first night in town to relax and unwind after a long drive.  We loved the local vibe and the bartenders were welcoming and very tuned in to their patrons.  The incredible selection of local craft brews was just what we were looking for!  These guys know their beer.  An impressive offering and a truly local eclectic find!  Fabulous!  (We did not stay to eat at Taphouse but what we did observe from other patrons looked great.)

data.title: Great beer selection
data.text: This local place has a great beer selection on tap. The selection includes local, national and international brews. Tuesdays is 50% off VA brews. Food is delicious as well. My friends and I meet regularly on the first Tuesday each month before we go the Air and Space Museum across the street to attend the Sigma Series Lecture.

data.title: Great Happy Hour Joint
data.text: Hit here 3 nights in a row while down in Hampton on business. Fun locals crowd and the appetizers are spot on. I had the Cuban sandwich 2 nights in a row and would eat it ever night if in town.

data.title: Taps galore!!
data.text:
We came for a quick drink and snack. This place was pretty good. They have numerous taps to select from unfortunately don't ask for a mixed drink, they don't know how to make much of anything. 
The food is excellent too! The mussels were amazing! We wanted seconds and thirds. The parsnip soup was interesting and tasty.
